experiment_info.name: random_timestep_selection
experiment_info.description: Use random 40% of timesteps instead of first 40% for CMA-ES evaluation
experiment_info.hypothesis: First 40% timesteps may miss important late-time dynamics. Random sampling captures different parts of temporal evolution, potentially providing more informative RMSE signal.

tuning_runs.reason_for_abort: Projected 350 min (5.8x over 60 min budget). Full simulation per evaluation is 3-4x slower than baseline which only simulates 40% of timesteps.

baseline_to_beat.algorithm: CMA-ES + first 40% timesteps + 8 NM polish (RMSE objective)

key_findings: Random timesteps as implemented requires FULL simulation (100% timesteps) then selecting 40% for RMSE
Baseline runs only 40% of simulation timesteps - this is the efficiency source, not which timesteps are used
Full simulation is 3-4x slower per sample (220s vs ~70s for 1-src, 416s vs ~120s for 2-src)
No accuracy benefit observed - RMSE values similar to baseline
temporal_sampling family should be marked FAILED
